page.title: 05MEMORIES OF AN 80 YEAR OLD
page.content: "Where the Technical college is now,it was fields with sheep in and a pig farm and it was all allotments and fields over the road where the Industrial Estate and all the houses are." {"The land by the railway was a tip and {lots of ashes were dumped there.That's {why the grass is always warm there {because when the sun is out the ashes {get hot." "There was a canal and trams.The canal boats carried food from Shardlow to Derby Market.Sometimes the canal flooded some of the houses!It cost only 2d.(that's less than 1p.)to go to town on the tram." {"When the bomb dropped in the war I {looked after lots of wounded soldiers. {Some children were evacuated to Belper {but I kept my 14 together.We had the {cellar made into an air raid shelter."
